stories.text:
I'm afraid that IT is quite aversive to employees of older ages. I do not seek to understand why and to what extent that is true but I am starting to bump into it.

I think though that there might be specific tech stacks and business domains that might be less aversive to older age and even actively seeking employees in age brackets of > 40 yrs old.

So, the question is, you have seen such patterns?

Thanks
stories.title: Which tech stacks and business domains are more age-friendly in IT?
15 Minute Grocery Delivery has come to NYC
Show HN: Stupid simple serverless P2P file sharing
Choosing a better climate future requires acting now
The Frenchman Who Pioneered the Modern Mercenary Industry
(macOS) Disk Utility now has full features for managing snapshots

stories.text:
I've been in several organizations where the developers have chosen fun or silly team names, rather than names that actually describe what they do.

I think it results in a lot of confusion within the organization and additional onboarding friction for new hires.

On the flip side, I acknowledge that it can be a morale booster and gives teams a way to express themselves.

Is there a way to meet in the middle here, or do you just have to weigh the pros and cons and choose fun vs. functional team names?
stories.title: Ask HN: How do you meet devs in the middle about 'fun' team names?
Landing AI brings in $57M for its machine learning operations tools
